storage.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used
storage.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: They moved to a house with lots of storage space.
storage.translation[0].definitions[1].de: when you pay to keep furniture or other goods in a special place until you need to use them
storage.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I put some of my things in storage.
storage.translation[0].definitions[2].de: the way that information is kept on a computer
storage.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the act of keeping or putting something in a place while it is not being used, or the space used for this
storage.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The premises were previously used for the storage of bank records.
Storage costs often exceed the value of goods stored during the normal turnover period.
We do not have much storage capacity (=space available for storing things).
All our office furniture had to be kept in storage.
Storage is very limited  (=there is not much room for storing things).
storage.translation[1].definitions[1].de: the price you pay for storing goods
storage.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: You will have to pay storage.
storage.translation[1].definitions[2].de: the means by which information is kept on a computer
storage.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: CD-Rom is an ideal system for data storage.
